other_tests.findings: Marked external compression of the left main-stem bronchus and left upper lobe; scant secretions in the airways; acid-fast staining of the BAL fluid revealed rare acid-fast bacilli.
Induration of 8 mm in diameter noted at the site.
Nucleated-cell count of 34 per microliter; Gramâ€™s staining, acid-fast staining, and calcofluor white staining revealed no organisms.
Blood and a mixed inflammatory infiltrate that was composed of lymphocytes, neutrophils, and loosely clustered histiocytes; acid-fast coccobacilli in histiocytes.
Histiocytic granulomas with central necrosis and acid-fast coccobacilli in histiocytes.
